body_html:
Thanks Dustin!

I think it's weird to have to remember this.

For example, if you have a Bernoulli distribution, you don't need the tf.stop_gradients.

Samples from distributions behaving differently in various contexts adds a lot of complexity to my code.

body:
Thanks Dustin! 

I think it's weird to have to remember this.

For example, if you have a Bernoulli distribution, you don't need the tf.stop_gradients. 

Samples from distributions behaving differently in various contexts adds a lot of complexity to my code.
